snippet: The Senate moved toward a vote to allow taxes to rise on the affluent and put off cuts in spending, but the House would not consider any deal until Tuesday, meaning Congress missed its deadline on the so-called fiscal cliff.
abstract: Senate moves toward vote to allow taxes to rise on affluent Americans and put off cuts in spending, but House will not consider any deal until Jan 1, causing Congress to miss its deadline on so-called fiscal cliff; under agreement, tax rates would jump for individual incomes over $400,000 and couples over $450,000, clear win for Pres Obama, who campaigned on higher taxes for the wealthy.

byline.contributor: Jennifer Steinhauer and Robert Pear contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Senate moved toward a vote to allow taxes to rise on the affluent and put off cuts in spending, but the House would not consider any deal until Tuesday, meaning Congress missed its deadline on the so-called fiscal cliff.

headline.seo: Tentative Accord Reached to Raise Taxes on Wealthy
headline.main: Tentative Deal Is Reached to Raise Taxes on the Wealthy
headline.print_headline: Tentative Accord Reached To Raise Taxes On Wealthy
